thread.title: Jose Mourinho confirms Man United transfer plans: He doesn’t intend to do this
thread.title_full: Jose Mourinho confirms Man United transfer plans: He doesn’t intend to do this

title: Jose Mourinho confirms Man United transfer plans: He doesn’t intend to do this
text:
Manchester United centre-back targets Fri, December 2, 2016 Express Sport takes a look at the superstar defenders Jose Mourinho must consider signing at Manchester United Man Utd via Getty Images 1 of 6 Express Sport takes a look at the superstar defenders Jose Mourinho must consider signing at Manchester United GETTY Jose Mourinho is happy with his defensive options GETTY Eric Bailly is heading to the Africa Cup of Nations I wait for Bailly. I hope the three [Chris Smalling, Phil Jones and Marcos Rojo] can control the situation Jose Mourinho 
Even though United will lose Eric Bailly, who is heading off to the Africa Cup of Nations, Mourinho insists he doesn’t feel the need to make any acquisitions in that department. 
When asked whether he will get cover for Bailly, Mourinho said: “No, I wait for Bailly. 
“I hope the three [Chris Smalling, Phil Jones and Marcos Rojo] can control the situation in those eight matches. GETTY Jose Mourinho has been impressed with Phil Jones' form 
"I will try to rest one in every game. On Saturday, I will rest one [against Reading in the FA Cup], against Hull [in the EFL Cup on Tuesday] another -- and we'll try to make a rotation between these three. 
"We still have Daley Blind as the fourth defender in case we need him to play there and we also have Michael Carrick, so let's try." 
United face Reading in the FA Cup third round today (12:30pm). Related articles
